  "article_text": [
    "before we start considerations let us recall some definitions and fix the notations . we consider _ @xmath2-algebras _ ,",
    "i.e. @xmath0-algebras for which the following two conditions are satisfied , ( @xcite ) :    \\(a ) in the partially ordered set of projections every set of pairwise orthogonal projections has a least upper bound .",
    "\\(b ) every maximal commutative self - adjoint subalgebra is generated by its projections , i.e. , it is equal to the smallest closed * -subalgebra containing its projections .",
    "a @xmath0-algebra is said to be _",
    "monotone complete _ if and only if every bounded increasingly directed net @xmath11 of self - adjoint elements of it has a least upper bound @xmath12 in it .",
    "every monotone complete @xmath0-algebra is an @xmath2-algebra . at present",
    "it is unknown whether every @xmath2-algebra is monotone complete or not , cf .",
    "but commutative @xmath2-algebras are monotone complete , ( @xcite ) .",
    "more examples of monotone complete @xmath2-algebras can be found at ( * ? ? ?",
    "* th.7 , th.8 ) , ( * ? ? ?",
    "* th.1 ) , @xcite .",
    "an @xmath2-algebra is called _ normal _ if every increasingly directed net of projections @xmath13 with supremum @xmath14 inside the net of all projections possesses a supremum with respect to the net of all self - adjoint elements ( being equal to @xmath14 automatically in the case of it s existence ) , cf .",
    "a @xmath0-algebra is _ additively complete _ if every norm - bounded sum of positive elements has a least upper bound .",
    "if * a * is a monotone complete @xmath0-algebra then one can define order convergence on * a*. for the commutative case this was done by h.  widom @xcite ( cf .",
    "@xcite ) , and for the general case by r.  v.  kadison and g.  k.  pedersen @xcite who defined the so - called kadison - pedersen arrow .",
    "m.  hamana @xcite modified the latter notion to get a general notion of order convergence",
    ". a net @xmath15 of elements of * a * _ converges to an element @xmath16*a * in order _ if and only if there are bounded nets @xmath17 and @xmath18 of self - adjoint elements of * a * and self - adjoint elements @xmath19*a * , @xmath20 , such that    \\(i ) @xmath21 ,    \\(ii ) @xmath22 is decreasingly directed and has greatest lower bound zero ,    \\(iii ) @xmath23 for every @xmath24 , @xmath25 , ( where @xmath26 )",
    ".    we denote this type of convergence by lim@xmath27 . by @xcite the order limit of @xmath28",
    "does not depend on the special choice of the nets @xmath29 and of the elements @xmath30 .",
    "if * a * is a commutative @xmath2-algebra then the order convergence defined above is equivalent to the classical order convergence in * a * as it was defined by h.  widom @xcite earlier .",
    "order convergence has the following properties , cf .",
    "* lemma 1.2 ) :    if lim@xmath31 , lim@xmath32 then    \\(i ) @xmath33lim@xmath34 ,    \\(ii ) @xmath35lim@xmath36 for every @xmath37 ,    \\(iii ) lim@xmath38 ,    \\(iv ) @xmath39 for every @xmath24 implies @xmath40 ,    \\(v ) @xmath41 .    throughout this paper",
    "we denote the @xmath0-norm of * a * by @xmath42 .",
    "the self - adjoint part of * a * is denoted by @xmath43 and the positive cone of * a * by @xmath44 .",
    "the centre of * a * has the denotation @xmath45 .    now some facts about hilbert @xmath0-modules .",
    "we make the convention that all @xmath0-modules of the present paper are left modules by definition .",
    "pre - hilbert * a*-module over a certain @xmath0-algebra _ * a * is an * a*-module @xmath1 equipped with an * a*-valued , non - degenerate mapping @xmath46 being * a*-linear in the first argument and conjugate-*a*-linear in the second , and satisfying @xmath47 for every @xmath48 . the map @xmath49 is called _ the * a*-valued inner product on _ @xmath1 . a pre - hilbert * a*-module @xmath50 is _ hilbert _ if and only if it is complete with respect to the norm @xmath51 .",
    "we always suppose that the linear structures of * a * and @xmath1 are compatible .",
    "denote by @xmath52 the norm closed linear hull of the range of the map @xmath53 in * a*. a hilbert * a*-module @xmath54 over a @xmath0-algebra * a * is said to be _ self - dual _ if and only if every bounded module map @xmath55 is of the form @xmath56 for a certain element @xmath57 .",
    "the set of all bounded module maps @xmath55 is denoted by @xmath3 .",
    "it is a banach * a*-module .",
    "a hilbert * a*-module is said to be _",

    ". then @xmath64-convergence is induced by the norm topology on @xmath131 , whereas the @xmath106-convergence is induced by the weak topology on @xmath131 , i.e. the two types of @xmath132-convergence do not coincide , in general . moreover , on hilbert * a*-modules over @xmath5-algebras * a * @xmath64-convergence is induced by a topology which is generated by the semi - norms @xmath133 , and @xmath106-convergence is induced by a topology which is generated by the linear functionals @xmath134 , cf .",
    "@xcite .",
    "does there exist a topology on monotone complete @xmath0-algebras inducing order convergence on them ?",
    "the answer is negative even in the commutative case .",
    "a simple example has been constructed by e.  e.  floyd @xcite in 1955 .",

    "now we show the implications ( i ) @xmath266 ( ii ) @xmath266 ( iii ) .",
    "the first implication is trivial by definition so we concentrate our attention to the second one .",
    "suppose a @xmath0-reflexive hilbert * a*-module @xmath6 does not have a @xmath64-complete unit ball .",
    "then consider the hilbert * a*-module @xmath299 being derived from @xmath1 in the way described at proposition 2.6 . since @xmath157 is self - dual by the assertions above , since @xmath300 and since @xmath301 , the banach * a*-module @xmath302 has to be identical with @xmath157 in contradiction to our assumption .",
    "the conditions ( i ) and ( iv ) are obviously equivalent . indeed ,",
    "if a non - self - dual hilbert * a*-module would possess a @xmath106-complete unit ball then its unit ball would have to be non-@xmath64-complete by the previous observations .",
    "but this contradicts its @xmath106-completeness by lemma 2.5 . in the same manner one",
    "shows the inverse implication .    in the case of *",

    "we give another proof using methods of order convergence .",

    "first , we formulate a classification of self - dual ( and hence , @xmath0-reflexive ) , countably generated hilbert @xmath0-modules over monotone complete @xmath0-algebras .",
    "@xmath0_-algebra and let _",
    "@xmath1 _ be a self - dual , countably generated hilbert _ * a*_-module . then there exist only the following two possibilities for the inner structure of _ * a * _ and of _ @xmath1 :    \\(i ) @xmath232 _ is finitely generated and _ * a * _ is arbitrary_.    \\(ii ) @xmath1 _ is decomposable into the direct sum of a finitely generated hilbert _ * a*_-module and a countably generated hilbert _ * b*_-module , where _ * b * _ is a finite - dimensional , two - sided _ @xmath0_-ideal of _ * a*.    p r o o f : the first statement follows from ( * ? ? ?",
    "* cor . ) .",
    "one has to show the second one and the completeness of the classification .",
    "suppose , the hilbert * a*-module @xmath1 is self - dual and countably generated . by theorem 5.2 one",
    "has @xmath427 for a certain countable set @xmath428 of projections of * a*. by an inductive process ( dividing in direct summands and taking direct sums ) one can reach a situation in which the pairwise product @xmath429 of every two projections @xmath430 @xmath431 of our choice is a projection if and only if @xmath432 .",
    "suppose this situation is realized . since @xmath1 is countably generated the sequence @xmath433 has to converge with respect to the * a*-norm for every element @xmath434 of @xmath435 .",
    "therefore , if there are more than a finite number of infinite dimensional , two - sided @xmath2-ideals @xmath436 of our choice , then the hilbert * a*-module @xmath437 can not be countably generated , cf .",
    "* th.4.3 ) . moreover , if there does not exist a finite dimensional , two - sided @xmath0-ideal * b * in * a * containing all the finite dimensional , two - sided @xmath0-ideals @xmath436 of our choice then the hilbert * a*-module @xmath438 can not be countably generated by ( * ? ? ? * th.4.3 ) , again .",
    "so the statements follow .",

    "@xmath104    this result seems to be of some importance .",
    "immediatelly one realizes that polar decomposition and spectral decomposition work inside @xmath474 in every such case , ( cf .",
    "theorem 3.2 and 3.6 ) . for investigations about similar monotone complete @xmath0-algebras theorem 6.4 allows , for example , to introduce a notion of `` morita equivalence in order '' along the line of the ideas of m.  a.  rieffel @xcite for @xmath5-algebras .",
    "another area of application is the theory of operator valued weights and conditional expectations of finite index between monotone complete @xmath0-algebras following m.  baillet , y.  denizeau and @xcite . but these investigations appear elsewhere , cf .  @xcite .",
    "what we will do is to prove a generalized weyl - berg theorem , which will finish up the present paper .",
    "the problem of approximation of normal elements in @xmath0-algebras * a * by diagonalizable elements of * a * up to a suitable small remainder is part of the sphere of interests of many mathematicians . for an overview on the recent results and open problems",
    "compare the papers of d.  voiculescu @xcite , r.  v.  kadison @xcite , k.  grove and g.  k.  pedersen @xcite , g.  j.  murphy @xcite , n.  higson and m.  rrdam @xcite , l.  g.  brown and g.  k.  pedersen @xcite and s.  zhang @xcite .",
    "what we would like is to show a weyl - berg type theorem for monotone complete @xmath0-algebras and some corollaries of it .",
    "a monotone complete @xmath0-algebra * a * has the _ approximation property _ ( * ) if there exists a chain of pairwise orthogonal projections @xmath236 of @xmath475 with least upper bound @xmath476 such that for every @xmath78 the monotone complete @xmath0-algebra @xmath477 possesses a faithful state @xmath478 with the property that the norm - completion of the pre - hilbert space @xmath479 is separable .",
    "the class of monotone complete @xmath0-algebras with the approximation property ( * ) is sufficiently large to contain most of the @xmath5-algebras of physical interest .",
    "the dixmier algebra d([0,1 ] ) has property ( * ) , too .",
    "but there are remarkable examples of @xmath5-algebras which do not have property ( * ) , cf .",
    "* remark after def . 2.5.1 . ) .",
    "other examples of commutative @xmath2-algebras without property ( * ) were constructed by m.  ozawa @xcite which can be seen by comparing proposition 7.6 and theorem 7.3 below .",
    "let * a * be a monotone complete @xmath0-algebra , let @xmath1 be a self - dual hilbert * a*-module possessing a countably generated * a*-pre - dual hilbert * a*-module .",

    "unfortunally , it is not quite clear at present if * a * has to possess property ( * ) to validate the statement of theorem 7.4 , or whether other situations are possible . beside this",
    "it is strange that a property of * a * should determine the truth of the generalized weyl - berg theorem with respect to the pair @xmath520 , because the intersection of the three @xmath0-algebras inside @xmath521 is only * z*(*a * ) , the centre of * a*. so the translation of ( * ) to a @xmath0-condition on @xmath522 appears to be non - easy if one tries to formulate it without reference to * a * , ( at least if * a * is non - commutative ) . however , there are some facts that shead light on the situation , cf .",
    "proposition 7.8 .    to prove the following fact",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> the aim of the present paper is to describe self - duality and @xmath0- reflexivity of hilbert * a*-modules @xmath1 over monotone complete @xmath0-algebras * a * by the completeness of the unit ball of @xmath1 with respect to two types of convergence being defined , and by a structural criterion . </S>",
    "<S> the derived results generalize earlier results of h.  widom [ duke math .  j.  23 , 309 - 324 , mr 17 # 1228 ] and w.  l.  paschke [ trans . </S>",
    "<S> amer .  </S>",
    "<S> math .  </S>",
    "<S> soc .  182 , 443 - 468 , mr 50 # 8087 , canadian j.  math .  26 , 1272 - 1280 , mr 57 # 10433 ] . </S>",
    "<S> for hilbert @xmath0-modules over commutative @xmath2-algebras the equivalence of the self - duality property and of the kaplansky - hilbert property is reproved , ( cf . </S>",
    "<S> m.  ozawa [ j.  math .  </S>",
    "<S> soc .  </S>",
    "<S> japan 36 , 589 - 609 , mr 85m:46068 ] ) . especially , one derives that for a @xmath0-algebra * a * the * a*-valued inner product of every hilbert * a*-module @xmath1 can be continued to an * a*-valued inner product on it s * a*-dual banach * a*-module @xmath3 turning @xmath3 to a self - dual hilbert * a*-module if and only if * a * is monotone complete ( or , equivalently , additively complete ) generalizing a result of m.  hamana [ internat .  </S>",
    "<S> j.  math .  </S>",
    "<S> 3(1992 ) , 185 - 204 ] . a classification of countably generated self - dual </S>",
    "<S> hilbert * a*-modules over monotone complete @xmath0-algebras * a * is established . </S>",
    "<S> the set of all bounded module operators @xmath4 on self - dual hilbert * </S>",
    "<S> a*-modules @xmath1 over monotone complete @xmath0-algebras * a * is proved again to be a monotone complete @xmath0-algebra . applying these results </S>",
    "<S> a weyl - berg type theorem is proved .    </S>",
    "<S> 0.5 cm 0.5 cm    recently , some progress was made in the theory of operator valued weights and conditional expectations of finite index on @xmath5-algebras @xcite , and in a generalized tomita - takesaki theory for embeddable @xmath2-algebras @xcite using self - dual hilbert @xmath5-modules and kaplansky - hilbert modules as the essential technical tool . </S>",
    "<S> however , as almost everywhere in the literature the theory was developed only as far as necessary for the solution of the main problem of the authors . since the tool `` hilbert @xmath0-module '' has been used by more and more mathematicians , previously in operator theory , it might be quite useful to sharpen the tool for getting deeper results in it s areas of application . </S>",
    "<S> all the more there are only a few such well - known basic publications on this subject like @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , for example . </S>",
    "<S> the present paper is an attempt to make a next step .    </S>",
    "<S> the concrete cause for the investigations below are two problems formulated by ( cf .  </S>",
    "<S> @xcite ) , and the problem of finding a purely @xmath0-algebraical approach to the diagonalization of operators up to a suitable small rest ( cf .  @xcite ) .    </S>",
    "<S> w.  l.  paschke raised the question for which @xmath0-algebras * a * the * a*-valued inner product on an arbitrary hilbert * a*-module @xmath1 can be lifted to an * a*-valued inner product on its * a*-dual banach * a*-module @xmath3 turning @xmath3 into a self - dual hilbert * a*-module . by his construction one can find such a lifting in the case of * a * being a @xmath5-algebra or a commutative @xmath2-algebra . on the other hand he showed that * a * has to be at least an @xmath2-algebra , cf .  </S>",
    "<S> ( * ? ? ? </S>",
    "<S> * th.3.2 . ) , ( * ? ? ? </S>",
    "<S> * prop.1 ) . refering to m.  hamana ( * ? ? ? </S>",
    "<S> * th . </S>",
    "<S> 2.2 ) and h.  lin ( * ? ? ? </S>",
    "<S> * lemma 3.7 ) we resolve this problem for monotone complete @xmath0-algebras affirmatively giving a general construction based on order convergence . </S>",
    "<S> moreover , glueing together results of m.  hamana @xcite and k.  sait , j.  d.  m.  wright @xcite we can show that this is the general solution of w.  l.  paschke s problem . </S>",
    "<S> however , the central problem of the @xmath2-theory , whether all @xmath2-algebras are monotone complete or not , is still open despite recent encouraging results ( @xcite ) .    </S>",
    "<S> the second problem under consideration is to describe the inner structure of self - dual hilbert * </S>",
    "<S> a*-modules @xmath1 over @xmath0-algebras * a*. w.  l.  paschke has found very nice criteria on self - duality and @xmath0-reflexivity in the case of * a * being a @xmath5-algebra or a commutative @xmath2-algebra . </S>",
    "<S> these ideas were extended by other authors . </S>",
    "<S> ( cf .  </S>",
    "<S> @xcite,@xcite,@xcite ) . </S>",
    "<S> moreover , the author was able to show that the self - duality of an arbitrary hilbert * a*-module @xmath1 over a @xmath0-algebra * a * does not depend on the _ properties _ of the concrete given * a*-valued inner product on @xmath1 realizing the self - duality , but only depends on the _ existence _ of such an * a*-valued inner product on the banach * a*-module @xmath1 inducing an equivalent norm to the given one , @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> therefore , one has the possibility to characterize self - duality of arbitrary hilbert @xmath0-modules by their inner structure . </S>",
    "<S> we give such a characterization in the case of * a * being a monotone complete @xmath0-algebra . on the way the interrelation is shown between the theory of kaplansky - hilbert modules and the theory of self - dual hilbert * a*-modules over commutative @xmath2-algebras , cf .  </S>",
    "<S> ( * ? ? ? </S>",
    "<S> * th.5.4),@xcite,@xcite,@xcite,@xcite .    </S>",
    "<S> these results allow us to prove some generalized weyl - berg type theorems for bounded , a - linear , normal operators on self - dual hilbert * a*-modules with countably generated * a*-pre - dual hilbert * a*-modules , where * a * is assumed to be monotone complete and to have a special approximation property ( * ) . </S>",
    "<S> an example shows that a weyl type decomposition can fail if the @xmath0-algebra * a * does not have property ( * ) .    </S>",
    "<S> let us remark that the theory of operator valued weights and conditional expectations of finite index on @xmath5-algebras in the approach of m.  baillet , y.  denizeau and @xcite can be generalized straightforward to the case of monotone complete @xmath0-algebras using the results of the present paper . </S>",
    "<S> but this appears elsewhere , cf .  </S>",
    "<S> @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> the main content of the present paper was previously circulated as a preprint , @xcite .    </S>",
    "<S> the present paper is organized as follows :    after a section about basic definitions and facts the second one is concerned with two types of convergence in hilbert * a*-modules over monotone complete @xmath0-algebras * a * and their properties . in section three a spectral decomposition theorem for normal elements of normal @xmath2-algebras and a polar decomposition theorem for arbitrary @xmath2-algebras </S>",
    "<S> are proved . </S>",
    "<S> two criteria on self - duality and @xmath0-reflexivity of hilbert @xmath0-modules are established in section four and five . </S>",
    "<S> they have several consequences of interest : for every hilbert * a*-module @xmath6 over a monotone complete @xmath0-algebra * a * the * a*-valued inner product @xmath7 can be continued to an * a*-valued inner product on its * a*-dual banach * a*-module @xmath3 turning @xmath3 into a self - dual hilbert * a*-module , ( section four ) . </S>",
    "<S> one obtains a classification of self - dual , countably generated hilbert * a*-modules over monotone complete @xmath0-algebras * a * , ( section six ) . </S>",
    "<S> the @xmath0-algebra @xmath8 of all bounded , * a*-linear operators on self - dual hilbert * a*-modules @xmath1 over monotone complete @xmath0-algebras * a * turns out to be monotone complete , again . </S>",
    "<S> hence , spectral and polar decomposition are possible inside @xmath8 , and one can consider some kind of von neumann representations of monotone complete @xmath0-algebras on such hilbert @xmath0-modules ( section seven ) . </S>",
    "<S> this last result gives us the chance to prove a generalized weyl - berg type theorem for the pair @xmath9 with * a * being a monotone complete @xmath0-algebra with the approximation property ( * ) . </S>",
    "<S> ( here @xmath10 denotes the set of all bounded , `` compact '' operators on @xmath1 . ) </S>",
    "<S> this is explained in section seven . </S>"
